3) a clever method of doing something (especially something new and different)

examples.en: ironing gets rid of most wrinkles
crease the paper like this to make a crane

wrist.definition: a joint between the distal end of the radius and the proximal row of carpal bones

wristband.definition: band consisting of a part of a sleeve that covers the wrist

wristlet.definition: a band or bracelet worn around the wrist

wristwatch.definition: a watch that is worn strapped to the wrist

writ.definition: (law) a legal document issued by a court or judicial officer

write.definition:
1) produce a literary work
2) communicate or express by writing
4) communicate (with) in writing

examples.en: Please write to me every week

write-in.definition: a vote cast by writing in the name of a candidate who is not listed on the ballot

write-off.definition:
1) (accounting) reduction in the book value of an asset
2) the act of cancelling from an account a bad debt or a worthless asset

writer.definition:
1) writes (books or stories or articles or the like) professionally (for pay)
2) a person who is able to write and has written something

writhe.definition: to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling)

examples.en: The child tried to wriggle free from his aunt's embrace

writing.definition:
1) the act of creating written works
2) the work of a writer; anything expressed in letters of the alphabet (especially when considered from the point of view of style and effect)
3) (usually plural) the collected work of an author

examples.en: writing was a form of therapy for him
it was a matter of disputed authorship
the writing in her novels is excellent
that editorial was a fine piece of writing
the idea occurs with increasing frequency in Hemingway's writings

written.definition:
1) set down in writing in any of various ways
2) systematically collected and written down

wrong.definition:
1) treat unjustly; do wrong to
2) contrary to conscience or morality or law
5) based on or acting or judging in error

examples.en: it is wrong for the rich to take advantage of the poor
it is wrong to think that way

wrongdoer.definition: a person who transgresses moral or civil law

wrongdoing.definition: activity that transgresses moral or civil law

wrongful.definition:
2) unlawfully violating the rights of others
3) not just or fair

examples.en: a wrongful diversion of trust income

wrongfully.definition: in an unjust or unfair manner

examples.en: the employee claimed that she was wrongfully dismissed
people who were wrongfully imprisoned should be released

wrongheaded.definition: obstinately perverse in judgment or opinion

examples.en: wouldst not play false and yet would wrongly win"- Shakespeare

w-shaped.definition: shaped in the form of the letter W

wu.definition: a dialect of Chinese spoken in the Yangtze delta

wuhan.definition: a city of central China on the Chang Jiang; the commercial and industrial center of central China

wulfenite.definition: a yellow to orange or brown mineral used as a molybdenum ore

wurtzite.definition: a brownish-black mineral consisting of zinc sulfide

wurzburg.definition: a city of south central Germany
